message: I have a question in closures, i excute and i understand the concept but what i made extra was to Console.log(MakeGreeting.language) after passing language as an argument, my question is isn't supposed to console " es " or "en" from the outer environment ? why it's undefined as when i log it but defined when i call the function expression ?

data.message: makeGreeting is a function that return a function ... You're trying to access language as if it is a property of an object. It should return undefined. This isn't issue related to closure :)

I would recommend you check this
http://stackoverflow.com/a/4472650/497828

- Parameters are much like local variables  
- You can only access parameters inside your function body 
- The issue is related to Scope not Closure 

For a much more detailed explanation refer to this book
https://github.com/getify/You-Dont-Know-JS/blob/master/scope%20%26%20closures/README.md

I think if you pass the language string as an object  key:value it will work because objects pass by reference so define this object above greet english var 
New to oop in JavaScript :)
Ok what made me examine this, is based on the concept of functions are objects and if it's about scope isn't the outer environment accessible?! I'm confused as hell

Since you're digging into JavaScript core to understand the internals I would recommend you read this book. This is one of the best AND the worst books to read about JavaScript.
استحمل وانت بتقراه وكمله واقراه أكتر من مرة ... حتفهم حاجات كتير جوه اللغة ماشية ازاي
http://www.javascriptenlightenment.com/
